displayName: Enable logging for AWS EKS Clusters
rationale: Exporting logs and metrics to a dedicated, persistent datastore such as CloudTrail ensures availability of audit data following a cluster security event, and provides a central location for analysis of log and metric data collated from multiple sources.
recommended_action:
1.Sign in to the AWS Management Console and open the EKS console at https://console.aws.amazon.com/eks. 
2. Click on Cluster Name of the cluster you are auditing.
3. Click Logging. You will see Control Plane Logging info. 
4. Ensure all 5 choices are set to Enabled.
error_message: Logging disabled for AWS EKS Cluster
ruleNames: Enable logging for AWS EKS Cluster
